clinical_study.brief_title: The Impact of Anti- Asthmatic Medications on Salivary pH and Dental Caries Pattern in a Group of Egyptian Children With Bronchial Asthma
clinical_study.official_title: The Impact of Anti- Asthmatic Medications on Salivary pH and Dental Caries Pattern in a Group of Egyptian Children With Bronchial Asthma: A Cohort Study

brief_summary.textblock: The impact of Anti- Asthmatic medications on salivary pH and dental caries pattern in a Group of Egyptian Children with Bronchial Asthma.

detailed_description.textblock: Due to lack of published studies about the impact of anti-asthmatic medications on salivary pH and dental caries pattern among the Egyptian children diagnosed with Bronchial Asthma, this study will be conducted to cover this point.

other_outcome.measure: Drug composition(pH and total sugar content)

arm_group.description: Aironyl syrup(Terbutaline sulfate ................. 1.5mg) 0.075-0.29 mg/ kg body weight 3 times daily Apidone syrup(Dexamethone) (0.02 to 0.3 mg per kilogram (kg) of body weight per day, divided and taken 3 or 4 times a day).

intervention.description: Aironyl syrup(Terbutaline sulfate ................. 1.5mg) 0.075-0.29 mg/ kg body weight 3 times daily Apidone syrup(Dexamethone) (0.02 to 0.3 mg per kilogram (kg) of body weight per day, divided and taken 3 or 4 times a day)

study_pop.textblock:
All patients presented to the Asthma and Allergy Outpatients Clinic of Abu El-Reesh Japanese hospital for kids will be included in the study according to the following criteria.
-Control group: All patients attending the pediatric dentistry department of faculty of dentistry of Cairo University will be included in the study according to the following criteria.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- - Children aged 6-12 years old diagnosed with Bronchial asthma (Mixed dentition stage).
- Control group : a matched group aged 6-12 years old
- Patients taking regular medications for the treatment of Bronchial asthma at least for 1 year back
- Both male and female patients will be included.
Exclusion Criteria:
- No other systemic Diseases.
